text.p: Following is a summary of expected new issues in the international primary debt market. The list was compiled from information provided by borrowers, banks mandated to lead manage the issues and other primary market sources. All terms and conditions are indicative.
Details of upcoming bond issues can be telephoned into the London newsroom on +44 171 542 8863
(OFFICIAL indicates confirmed by borrower)
DOLLARS
+ KEXIM, $500 million five-year bond, low 40s b.p. over, Nomura and SBC Warburg, early September
+ FANNIE MAE, ITALY, TENESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY eyeing 10-year global or Eurobond
+ FRANCE TELECOM, five-year deal mooted for September
+ NORDBANKEN, $100 million subordinated step-up perpetual FRN, five-year call, J.P. Morgan, launch in August
+ ONTARIO, up to $2.0 billion of five or 10-year, pricing at around 30 b.p. over on a five-year, mooted for September
+ SPAIN, up to $2.0 bln 5-yr bond, possibly an FRN, late Q3
+ TMCC, five-year Euro-Asian bond
+ City of YOKOHAMA, $300 million 10-year, Bank of Tokyo
MARKS
+ BANKGESELLSCHAFT, one bln mark five-year Eurobond via C.S. First Boston Effectenbank and J.P. Morgan.
+ France's CADES, long-dated mark issue
+ CHUGOKU ELECTRIC, 350 million marks via Commerzbank
+ DEUTSCHE BAHN, one bln mark 10-year offering
+ L-BANK, up to 1.0 billion mark five-year bond, +20 bp, week of September 2
+ NESTLE and UNILEVER eyeing the sector
+ LB RHEINLAND-PFALTZ, global mark bond, Lehman/Morgan Stanley, mid-September
OTHER CURRENCIES
+ AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, 2.0 billion French franc bond via Societe Generale (OFFICIAL)
+ DOCKLANDS LIGHT RAILWAY, 150 million stg 20-year securitised bond, BZW
+ FANNIE MAE, eyeing French franc sector for later this year
+ ITALY, debut French franc bond, up to 7.0 billion Ffr
+ NORTHERN ROCK, LLOYDS and ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND in stg.
+ ONTARIO, BRITISH COLUMBIA eyeing Canadian dollars
+ SASKATCHEWAN, expected to launch a Canadian dollar deal
+ WORLD BANK, inaugural Ecu bond, also Korean Won issue.
ASSET-BACKED/STRUCTURED
+ FIRST CHICAGO, self-led 7 or 10-yr asset-backed global FRN
+ ORCHID SECURITIES, $400 million asset-backed FRN,Merrill Lynch
+ PUMA MANAGEMENT (Australia) planning three-tranche mortgage-backed FRN for $400 million by end Q3 via JP Morgan
+ SPV RESIDENTIAL REINSURANCE LTD, $500 million, Merrill Lynch, first public bond whose principal payments dependent on losses incurred by insurance group USAA.
+ Britain's STAGECOACH HOLDINGS, set to launch largest asset-backed sterling bonds in September, 535 million stg securitisation of train leases, UBS
+ CITIBANK, DEAN WITTER, securitised mark bonds
EMERGING MARKETS SOVEREIGNS AND QUASI-SOVEREIGNS
+ BRAZIL, $1.0 billion Brady bond exchange via Goldman
+ BUCHAREST, $150 million three-year bond via Merrill Lynch
+ CHILE, COLOMBIA, CZECH REPUBLIC, ECUADOR and ROMANIA eyeing marks
+ Peru's COFIDE $50 million of $300 EMTN programme via Merrill
+ CROATIA, $250 million 5-year, after rating
+ HUNGARY $500 million global DMG/Merrill, on hold to September
+ ISRAEL, $750 million EMTN programme, $200 million Eurobond in fourth quarter of 1996, Merrill Lynch (OFFICIAL)
+ KAZAKHSTAN, plans a $100 million Eurobond by September, lead manager ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett (OFFICIAL)
+ MOSCOW, $300 million three-year Eurobond (OFFICIAL). Q4
+ PERU, $75 million before year-end (OFFICIAL)
+ Debut PHILIPPINE-PESO Eurobond, ING Barings
+ PHILIPPINES, $1.9 bln Eurobonds in exchange for Brady bonds via J.P. Morgan. Offer closes September 20. Fixed-rate tranche due 2016 (250-300 b.p. over Treasuries), FRN due 2011.
+ RUSSIA, Up to $500 million in October via JP Morgan/SBC Warburg. Waiting for ratings (OFFICIAL). Could set unrated issue

+ SOUTH AFRICA, up to 500 million marks at five-or seven years via Deutsche Morgan Grenfell and Morgan Stanley. Expected mid-Sept after roadshows week of Sept 9 (OFFICIAL) Yankee bond, Merrill Lynch, up to $300 million at 10 years mooted
+ THAILAND, $200 million FRN at five years, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, price talk Libor plus 5/7 b.p. all in. POSTPONED
+ TUNISIA, 20 billion yen Samurai bond
+ TURKEY, up to 200 million marks week of September 2. Also 50 billion yen seven-year Samurai bond
+ URUGUAY, $100 million 10-year bond, CS First Boston, September launch
+ VIETNAM, $100-$150 million, Merrill Lynch and Nomura after rating, Q4 1996 possible
+ VENEZUELA, 1.0 billion mark seven-year bond, WestLB lead, expected in September (OFFICIAL)
EMERGING MARKET BANKS AND CORPORATES
+ Brazil's ACESITA, $150 million eight-year Eurobond via ABN AMRO, September roadshow (OFFICIAL)
+ Indonesia's ASIA PULP & PAPER, $500 million, UBS
+ Mexico's BANCO BITAL, $100 million asset-backed 3-yr FRN, SBCW
+ Brazil's BANCO REAL, $100 million 3-year, West Merchant Bank
+ Poland's BRE, Bank Rozwoju Exportu, $100 million three-year FRN, below 85 bp over Libor, September (OFFICIAL)
+ Lebanon's BYBLOS BANK, $50 million three-year bond, +300 b.p., SBC Warburg and Lebanon Invest, launch September 9 (OFFICIAL)
+ Brazil's CESP considering global bond (OFFICIAL)
+ Brazil's CEVAL ALIMENTOS, $100 million, Citibank
+ ELETROPAULO, Sao Paulo's state energy company, Eurobond debut in Q2 with a $420 million deal at 550-650 b.p. over.
+ MULIA LAND PT, $200 million two-tranche bond, three- and five-year tranches, launch after August 7, JP Morgan (OFFICIAL)
+ Malaysia's PETRONAS, $500 million, no mandate yet
+ PHILIPPINE COMMERCIAL INTERNATIONAL BK, $100 million, Merrill
+ Czech RADEGAST, 70 million mark five-year Eurobond, Nomura
+ SIAM CITY BANK, $100 million five-year bond via JP Morgan
+ TELEBRAS, $300 million bond via UBS
+ TELECOM ARGENTINA, seven-year mark bond
